comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
@AdamWr I think for `json-prune-fetch-response` scriptlets, we should exclude `ext_ublock` since the current converter will convert

```adblock
bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('json-prune-fetch-response', 'data.item.[-].business_info.ad_desc', '', '/feed/rcmd')
```

into

```adblock
bilibili.com+js(json-prune-fetch-response, data.item.[-].business_info.ad_desc, , /feed/rcmd)
```

which would ignore `/feed/rcmd` and match all `fetch` requests and cause issues for uBO. The scriptlet for uBO needs `propsToMatch` before the URL match `/feed/rcmd`.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Nie potrafię tego odtworzyć.
Spróbuj proszę wyłączyć a następnie włączyć blokery zawartości w ustawieniach Safari, zaktualizować filtry i sprawdź proszę czy "zaawansowana ochrona" jest włączona.

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/211699#issue-3334964889 - I cannot reproduce ads.

<hr>

> PICTURES ARE IRRELEVANT TO THIS ISSUE.
> 
> So I noticed a problem when using Adguard filtering on my PC. Sometimes the site starts stuttering/lagging a lot with filtering on.
> 
> I found that the issue is with "stats" being blocked on the site. I allowed it with this rule: `@@||music.youtube.com/api/stats/$domain=music.youtube.com`
> 
> This completely fixed the lagging issue I had.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/211699#issuecomment-3207811523 - I have never noticed an issue like that on my end and I don't recall any similar reports.
Please keep this rule in user rules.

<hr>

>Se me queda la pantalla en negro

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/211699#issuecomment-3208309540 - Which filter lists causes this problem?
Do you have any user rules?

comment.body:
Okay, so as far as I understand, it might be caused by blocking cookie notice in iframe.
Could you please add following rules to user rules (one rule per line) and then check if issue still occurs?
```adblock
@@||sdk.privacy-center.org/*/loader.js$domain=laliga.com
@@||sdk.privacy-center.org/sdk/$domain=laliga.com
laliga.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', '#didomi-notice-agree-button')
```

issue.title: Better Klaviyo tracking

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Problem description

Klaviyo Javascript is being blocked due to the addition of this rule

```
||static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/telemetry
||static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/event_adapter
||a.klaviyo.com
```


### Proposed solution

The correct blocked script should be

```
||static-tracking.klaviyo.com/onsite/*
```
which blocks any analytics scripts/API requests/etc that Klaviyo uses for shopper identification.

We should _not_ be blocking requests to `a.klaviyo.com`. That rule should be removed.

### Additional information

A similar issue was submitted: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/210120#issuecomment-3128250521

But the fix implemented was not the proposed solution.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
With the first one the issue is solved. Thank you.

> Okay, so as far as I understand, it might be caused by blocking cookie notice in iframe.
> Could you please add following rules to user rules (one rule per line) and then check if issue still occurs?
> ```adblock
> @@||sdk.privacy-center.org/*/loader.js$domain=laliga.com
> @@||sdk.privacy-center.org/sdk/$domain=laliga.com
> laliga.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', '#didomi-notice-agree-button')
> ```

```adblock
@@||sdk.privacy-center.org/*/loader.js$domain=laliga.com

laliga.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', '#didomi-notice-agree-button')
```

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Better Klaviyo tracking

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Problem description

Klaviyo Javascript is being blocked due to the addition of this rule

```
||static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/telemetry
||static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/event_adapter
||a.klaviyo.com
```


### Proposed solution

The correct blocked script should be

```
||static-tracking.klaviyo.com/onsite/*
```
which blocks any analytics scripts/API requests/etc that Klaviyo uses for shopper identification.

We should _not_ be blocking requests to `a.klaviyo.com`. That rule should be removed.

### Additional information

A similar issue was submitted: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/210120#issuecomment-3128250521

But the fix implemented was not the proposed solution.

comment.body:
> Please provide, we can create rules for non-DNS blocking.

Hi @Alex-302  - blocking a.klaviyo.com in its entirety also blocks some of our subscriptions endpoints that are critical for Klaviyo forms. These API requests are only made when a user voluntarily submits information to a form. With this domain blocked in its entirety it would essentially made forms unable to function.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.computerbase.de/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.computerbase.de%2F) ### Comment > I've noticed over the last couple of weeks that the cookie pop-up loads every hour or so and needs to be removed/accepted via Adguard for Windows. If I visit the webpage the next day, it's there again and goes away after 1–2 seconds. Prior to this... This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Better Klaviyo tracking

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Problem description

Klaviyo Javascript is being blocked due to the addition of this rule

```
||static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/telemetry
||static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/event_adapter
||a.klaviyo.com
```


### Proposed solution

The correct blocked script should be

```
||static-tracking.klaviyo.com/onsite/*
```
which blocks any analytics scripts/API requests/etc that Klaviyo uses for shopper identification.

We should _not_ be blocking requests to `a.klaviyo.com`. That rule should be removed.

### Additional information

A similar issue was submitted: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/210120#issuecomment-3128250521

But the fix implemented was not the proposed solution.

comment.body:
> Please provide, we can create rules for non-DNS blocking.

Hi @Alex-302  - blocking a.klaviyo.com in its entirety also blocks some of our subscriptions endpoints that are critical for Klaviyo forms. These API requests are only made when a user voluntarily submits information to a form. With this domain blocked in its entirety it would essentially made forms unable to function.
